messages.title: Voting Labour or UKIP here will just help the Tories make £50 billion of extra cuts
messages.content: The Tories have rejected a plea from doctor’s leaders to... guarantee the NHS an extra £8 billion a year by 2020. Conservatives to cut school funding by 10% if they win general election.

messages.title: Only a vote for Gerald Vernon-Jackson and the Lib Dems will keep the Tories out of Portsmouth South.
messages.content: In Portsmouth, the Labour and UKIP councillors voted the Tories into power. Together, they voted to cut £50,000 from local charities and services to Portsmouth’s most vulnerable residents.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The bookies are putting Labour at 25/1 outsiders. Even The News said: 'Labour's chances [in Portsmouth South] being dismissed.' - Feb 2015. Voting Labour, UKIP or Green will just let the Tory candidate sneak in, meaning we are one step closer to a majority Tory government and £50 billion of cuts to schools, hospitals and police.

issues.health: The Tories have rejected a plea from doctor’s leaders to... guarantee the NHS an extra £8 billion a year by 2020.

housing.content: In Portsmouth, the Labour and UKIP councillors voted the Tories into power. Together, they voted to cut £50,000 from local charities and services to Portsmouth’s most vulnerable residents.

images.caption: Graph showing 2010 General Election result in Portsmouth South with Lib Dem at 46%, Con at 33%, Lab at 14%, UKIP at 2% and Green at 2%.
